summary: Public companies are required to disclose material risks that could affect their finances or operations in their Securities and Exchange Commission filings. These may include climate-related risks—for example, a need to improve facilities to meet emission requirements. We reviewed steps SEC has taken to clarify companies' climate-related disclosure requirements. Industry representatives told us that they consider the requirements to be clear and adequate. At the...
title: Climate-Related Risks: SEC Has Taken Steps to Clarify Disclosure Requirements
